summary: So far, we have established that you enjoy the way smoking calms you and dislike the smell of cigarettes. You want to make a conscious decision to quit smoking, and you understand that this will require willpower and will improve your health and appearance. Does this accurately capture our conversation so far? Is there anything else you'd like to add?

Thank you for sharing your thoughts and experiences with me. I understand that you enjoy the calming effect that smoking has on you, as well as the physical act of smoking itself. On the other hand, you don't like the smell that comes with smoking. You don't want to make a change to your smoking habit, but you do recognize that it will require discipline and persistence. To make this change, you are considering keeping yourself busy in other ways. Is this an accurate summary of our conversation so far? Is there anything else you would like to add?

So, to summarize what we've discussed so far, you enjoy the stress relief smoking provides, but are aware of the health risks associated with it. You would like to reduce or stop smoking among your friends, and to do this you intend to use nicotine replacement therapy (NRT). Does this accurately capture what we talked about? Are there any other thoughts or feelings you would like to add?

It sounds like you're working towards a goal of quitting smoking altogether, but you're not sure what should replace it. You're aware of the negative effects that smoking has on your health and you want to find a healthier alternative. You're looking for a substitute that you can use to replace smoking and help you make the change. Is that an accurate summary of what we've discussed so far?

So far, it sounds like you're looking to change your smoking habit because you're concerned about the health effects and don't like the smell. You'd like to reduce the number of cigarettes you smoke to improve your health and smell. You understand that it will require discipline to make this change. Is this a fair summary of our conversation so far? Is there anything else that you'd like to add?

So, to summarize, you enjoy the flavor of tobacco and are looking for ways to relax, but are concerned about the health effects of smoking. You would like to reduce the number of cigarettes you smoke, which you believe will improve your health and smell, and this requires discipline. Does this accurately capture our conversation so far? Is there anything else you'd like to add?

It sounds like you are aware of the negative effects that smoking has on your health, and you would like to make a change. You understand that reducing the amount of cigarettes you smoke daily is the first step to quitting smoking, and that this will help you improve your overall health. Does this summary accurately reflect our conversation so far?

So far, it sounds like you want to reduce the amount of cigarettes you smoke in order to relax and unwind. You are aware that cigarettes can cause addiction, and you want to make a change in your smoking habit by limiting yourself to two cigarettes per day. You want to reduce the amount of cigarettes you smoke and will do so by smoking in the morning and evening. Does this summary accurately reflect our conversation and is there anything else you'd like to add?

It sounds like you're motivated to make a change in your smoking habit, and understand that reducing the number of cigarettes you smoke is a good start. You appreciate that it will help your health and make you feel more proud of yourself. You're going to need to create a plan with a specific number of cigarettes you're allowed to smoke per day in order to make this change. Does this accurately capture what we've discussed so far? Is there anything else you'd like to add?

It sounds like you are aware of the effects of smoking on your health and wish to make a change. You have identified that you would like to stop smoking completely, and have identified that you need to find other ways to cope with your smoking habit on nights out. Is this an accurate summary of our conversation and is there anything else you would like to add?

So far, it sounds like you feel joy when you smoke, but you don't like the smell it leaves on your clothes. You want to reduce your consumption and believe that this will make you happy. You understand that you need to take steps to reduce your tobacco use and cut back. Is this an accurate summary of the conversation so far, and is there anything else you want to add?

It sounds like you appreciate the role smoking plays in punctuating your day and filling your free time, however, you are concerned about the negative impacts it has on your energy levels. You are not interested in making changes to your smoking habit at the moment, although you recognize that it could be important to quit smoking one day. Is this an accurate summary of our conversation so far?

therapist: Ah, I understand. You want to make a conscious effort to go out with friends who don't smoke and practice not smoking when you are with friends who do smoke. Does this summary of our conversation accurately capture your thoughts and feelings? Is there anything else you'd like to add?

So far, you have shared that you feel smoking helps you with dealing with stressful situations, but that you don't like the smell. Your goal is to smoke less, though you are not sure what that will look like. You recognize that motivation is the key to making this change. Does this adequately capture our conversation so far, and is there anything you would like to add?

It sounds like you feel relaxed after smoking, but dislike the smell of cigarette smoke. You would like to reduce or stop smoking to improve your financial situation, and think that calculating the yearly cost may shock you into quitting. Is this an accurate summary of our conversation so far, and is there anything else you would like to add?

To summarize, you feel that smoking provides relaxation, but that it is also bad for your health. You would like to change your smoking habit by cutting down and working towards quitting completely, in order to be healthier and have fewer cravings. To make this change, you will need to cut down on smoking and set a goal of quitting completely. Does this summary accurately capture the conversation so far?

It sounds like you are feeling frustrated about your smoking habit, and you want to make changes. You said that you like the feeling of inhaling and letting go of the cigarette smoke, but you also don't like that you are spending a lot of money. You would like to reduce the number of cigarettes you smoke from 10 to 5 per day, and you think this will have a positive effect on your health. You believe that you have the willpower and the desire to make this change, though you're not sure if this is enough. Is this a fair summary of our conversation so far?

Summarizing our conversation, you want to reduce your smoking habit by cutting back on cigarettes and eventually transitioning to vaping. You feel that reducing the number of cigarettes you smoke each day will help you quit smoking for good and that it will make you feel better in the long run. Does this sound like an accurate summary of what we discussed?

Overall, it seems like you want to reduce the amount of cigarettes you smoke when you are drinking alcohol, in order to avoid the negative impacts it has on your physical and mental health. You are aware that this will require self-discipline and have acknowledged the consequences of smoking. Does this summary accurately reflect your conversation so far? Is there anything else you would like to add?

It's encouraging to hear that you enjoy the feeling of relaxation after smoking, but you also don't like the smell of cigarettes. You are motivated to make a change and want to quit smoking, and you believe that this change will bring you more physical and mental wellbeing. You plan to do this by gradually reducing the amount of cigarettes you smoke. Does this capture the conversation we had so far? Is there anything else you would like to add?
